column3:
This PR contains identical commits then #8328 and #8329.
Can you explain why there are multiple PRs?
IMO opening a single small PR and trying to get this merge would be more efficient (and only open/PR further work when the first part has been merged).

Each PR contains more things than the previous one. I could make them
independent for easier review instead of each one building on top of the
previous, but that would more work. Or I can just close them. Only the
first one seems to be getting any review anyway...
On Jul 14, 2016 1:52 PM, "Jonas Schnelli" notifications@github.com wrote:

> This PR contains identical commits then #8328
> htt
A diff wrt. #8329 (since it builds on it) https://github.com/jtimon/bitcoin/compare/jtimon:0.12.99-consensus-moveonly-tx...0.12.99-consensus-moveonly-header\n

Updated as independent from  #8329 and #8328 (closed).
@afk11 Thanks for the selected diffs, I think they're very useful for review.
Perhaps I should do the same on any PR I make dependent on another one.
But please keep looking for diffs you think you're interesting, I'm always open to squashes and interactive rebasing for things that have not been merged.
needs rebase\n
Rebased.\n
Verified it is move only. ACK\n
utACK, move only 6d559b2af4925404ba2542d3c644da15a337dbc7\n
Sorry for breaking the reviews, but it was suggested that declaring the functions in consensus/header_verify.h instead of consensus/consensus.h would be more clear.\n
utACK d324e016a
Fixed @morcos 's nit.
utACK 6a66d7a242387ea73bf5f40154ef011b246c1a02
Needed rebase after renaming main.o, see #9260 (although needed, the rebase was clean in this case)\n
utACK 4d17675\n

Needed rebase after #9908 and after [some other PR to locate that introduces the assert in ContextualCheckBlockHeader].\nAfter #9908 , added a commit to move MAX_FUTURE_BLOCK_TIME from chain.h to consensus/consensus.h

Needed trivial rebase in the makefile after #8329 was merged. For next rebase (which will hopefully be needed soon, see #9717 and #10339 ), I'm thinking of directly moving CheckBlockHeader to pow.o instead of consensus/header_verify.o. People are even talking about removing it. Thoughts?
Needs rebase again and this was for #8493 anyway, closing.
same issue here.  this should not be removed.

In commit "MOVEONLY: MAX_FUTURE_BLOCK_TIME to consensus/consensus.h"\n\nNot sure if if it's exactly right to make this a consensus constant, because even in the worst case if this is set inconsistently, consensus should eventually be reached when system clock times catch up. IIRC, this was the reasoning @morcos gave me for not defining this constant in consensus.h.

The goal is more to take it out of chain.h than to put it in consensus/consensus.h. consensus/header_verify would be fine as well. As an example, #8493 puts the check in libconsensus without putting chain.o in libconsensus too. Whether blocks eventually become valid when violating this rule or not, I think the question that should be asked is "in a hypothetical finished libconsensus, is this check
